content.description:
A fun warm up route on the far right side of this feature.

Climb the edge of the flake and go straight up the bulge
content.protection: 8 bolts to anchor
content.location: Head left of the waterfall and Swinger is the second route from the right on Powers Wall, Just left of a short free standing pillar climb. Swinger starts on a large flake. Another route 'Groovy Baby' starts on Swinger and goes left.

content.description:
The Route starts out moderate and gets harder as you go. It has cleaned up nicely from what I have been told.

There is an extension into a 13a if you are looking for more.
content.protection: 11 bolts and a sport anchor.
content.location: Begins just right of the crack.  Step off the dirt ledge to the right and into a line of good pockets.

content.description: Starts on a black slab for the first couple bolts, them climbs the ever steepening yellow rock, getting progressively harder.
content.protection: 17  bolts + 2-bolt anchor
content.location: The obvious longest route on the right side of the Powers wall. Much taller than the neighbors on both sides.

content.description:
Crikeys!  This is fabu-fricking-tastic!

Climb the intro Shmoke, which ain't too bad either, aiming for that crack splitting the bulge.  Rest a bit and go for it.  It's a bit of a sprint through the bulge as long as you know how to do it.  Good luck if its your first go.  Techy through the upper headwall and easy to blow it.  This is a sweet pitch!
content.protection: 12 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: Climb Shmoke, continue through the bulge following the crack.

content.description: A fun moderate romp up the lower wall on good pockets and edges.  You are aiming for the crack that splits the bulge.  Sport clips below the bulge.  This is a fun first pitch.
content.protection: 7 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: This is the one that has the extension following the crack through the bulge.

content.description: Good line up an interesting slab and then into a fun overhang. Fun moves, although some of the feet are still cleaning up and I had a few chip off on me. The anchor could definitely use an upgrade as of July 2019 it's a bolt with a single chain on it.
content.protection: 8 bolts to single bolt and chain anchor.
content.location: Located on Powers Wall, follow the trail that heads left of the Waterfall. Sharks heads up the overhang on the right side of the wall but the furthest left of the lines that bust through the slab and wave-like overhang.

content.description: Awesome route. Delicate, involved slab climbing leads to some big juggy pulls through the overhanging wave with a definitive crux on pockets laying in wait. Excellent climbing.
content.protection: 9 Bolts and a carabiner/ coldshut anchor.
content.location: On Powers Wall left of the Waterfall Wall. Shaguar climbs near the middle of the wavelike formation on the right side of Powers Wall. Just right of Sharks with Lazers.

content.description:
Climb Felicity Shagwell to the first set of anchors at the base of the scoop.

The climbing tilts back and the good times begin.  Great pockets and super movement.  Don't futz about or you will get pumped out and she'll boot your butt out into space.  This one stays on you until the bitter end.  Treat her right and she'll reward you handsomely.
content.protection: 15 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: Begin on Felicity Shagwell.

content.description: Climb Scotty to the first anchor and blast through the bulge on good little two-finger pockets.  Steep and powerful in the bulge and continuing up the slightly overhung headwall on more little two-fers.  Great and kinda hard!
content.protection: 14 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: This climb starts on Scotty and continues through the bulge to the right of the obvious crack system.

content.description: Scotty is another decent pocket pulling vertical climb.
content.protection: 8 bolts + anchor
content.location: Next climb left of the excellent  “Fook Mi”

content.description:
"So which is it baby? Spits or Swallows"  A. Powers

Oh snap, this one is good!!  Spits is quite the gem but Swallows is a pure unadulterated good time.  There are some big moves on this one.  If you are tall and strong. this is for you, easy peazy.  Shorter and you're going to have to get creative.  I'm 6' and it felt like .13a.  Keep telling yourself, I'm a hero, like Robert Dinero.
content.protection: 12 bolts and a set of fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors.
content.location: Climb Robin Spits and continue up the extension.

content.description:
From top of dirt platform, climb to flake/ ledge and cruise straight up.

The bite is at the end. Mostly low .11 cruising.
content.protection: 8 bolts

content.description: Another fun face climb.  This one starts out fairly easy but as the angle tips back the moves get harder.  The pump begins to mount.  Low anchor before Pure Evil, the extension.
content.protection: 10 bolts and a set of fatty Climb Tech hooks for an anchor.
content.location: Begins on the dirt and rock ledge just right of the pointy boulder.

content.description: Extension to Quasi Evil.
content.protection: bolts to a 2 bolt sport anchor

content.description: This climb shares the first two moves with Dixie but goes left to a generous edge.  Wander your way up the wall on good pockets and edges reminiscent of the other routes to the right.  There is no lower anchor, so get ready to giddy up when you reach the bulge.  This is a rad sequence that involves a cross into a deep mono and a huck to a good pocket.
content.protection: 12 bolts and a fatty set of climb tech hooks for anchors
content.location: Starts at the far left of the rising shelf.

content.description: Climb Swedish Penis Enlarger to the low anchor and continue up the clean headwall.  Small holds and powerful pulls lead to tough finish.
content.protection: 15 bolts and a sport anchor
content.location: From the top right side of the dirt ledge.  Climbs to the right of the obvious short crack.

content.description:
Intro slab climbing to the steep(ish) break. Climb for 3 bolts of steeper moves that are on sharp pockets with challenging feet. Holds are far and several beta sequences can be utilized. This route is posted as 12a, but it felt harder than Shag, to the left and definitely harder than Fat Bastard. Maybe 12b/c as Shag.. but different style (less gymnastic)... definitely a fun one on all natural rock.

***Route just has hangers and rings.. no climb tech anchors like most other routes here.***
content.protection: 8 and 2 for the anchor if you want.
content.location: Just to the right of Shag. Stick clipping the 2nd is helpful.

content.description:
WARNING: The second bolt is very loose (this is the reason for the PG-13 rating). It should be rebolted. It seems to be a case of a too short bolt in a poorly formed hole.

This is the rightmost route at the wall. It starts in a wide crack and continues up an arete on large smooth pockets.
content.protection: 4 bolts. 2nd bolt is very loose

content.description:
Where is the fifth star?? or maybe even a sixth...  This is my favorite on the wall.

Not many pockets on this one but there are good ones where you need them.  I found and cleaned all the holds on this route and it still took some serious effort to figure out how to climb it.  It's quite difficult, but as usual, the right sequence...  Do this route!!!

Btw, I skipped #11, no friggin' way I could clip it.  The fall is exhilerating.  (Maybe I'll move that bolt down a bit)
content.protection: 12 bolts and a set of fatty Climb Tech hooks for an anchor.
content.location: Climb Ivana and get your your hump on.

content.description: This one zigs right and then back left when the crack ends.  Easy-ish climbing until the angle changes.  There are some powerful pulls but the holds are pretty good.  Had to climb this one a bunch to send Humpalot.  I liked it more each time I went up the route, I hope you do too.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a set of fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors.
content.location: Begins up on the dirt ledge and takes the crack initially, which peters out after 10 feet.

content.description:
11b in the guidebook, but that must have been before "alterations". The route was not red-tagged when we tried it, but it had couple pockets filled in with grey concrete. You cannot see the filled-in pockets from the ground, but the most notable is the clipping hold for 4th bolt, making the clipping much more difficult than the 11b grade.

The fall there will likely have unpleasant consequences, because of the slabby flake below. The rest of the filled in pockets up high don't make much of a difference.
content.protection: 8 bolts + 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Starts on the same flack as Swinger, and branches left at the top of the flake, after the 2nd bolt.

content.description:
The climber begins by stepping out left off the shelf and onto the wall.  The crux comes quickly and requires steely fingers and a tight core.  Stick clip the 2nd bolt to be safe, as this is a tough clip.  Cruise up the wall on pockets and edges aiming for the dihedral at the left edge of the upper bulge.  The holds dissappear so you will have to be creative.  No lower anchor on this one.  Fun!

The belayer should probably be down in the hole. It's flat and there's plenty of room to spread the rope out, plus you'll be better positioned to catch falls from the low crux.
content.protection: 9 bolts and fatty climb tech hooks for anchors
content.location: This the farthest left route at Powers Wall.

content.description:
The bolted route directly right of Soul Bossa Nova. This climb is still pretty fresh and should be climbed with caution as rocks are still exfoliating from the surface. Begin on a black, techy slab and gain the easier terrain a couple of bolts above, continue up and onward into the great unknown, plant your feet, rip those pockets off the wall, and power upward gaining some better holds.

As with many routes at the Powers Wall, this route has an extension (5 bolts I believe) leading you up into the thinner and much harder belly of the wall. For the full package rack up 15 draws plus anchors and prepare to fight for this one.
content.protection: 9 Bolts plus 2 Bolt Anchor.
content.location: Right of "Soul Bossa Nova" Left of "Sharks with Lazers"

content.description: Tricky start on sharp slabby black rock, with straightforward climbing above the start. Climb to the first anchors below the bulge. 12c extension to the 2nd set of anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location:
2nd route to the left of an obvious black boulder, about 15 feet left of the boulder.

This climb ends at the first set of anchors.  Fook Mi continues on through the bulge.

content.description: Climb Fook Yu which ends at the first set of anchors.  Keep going trending a bit left up the left edge of the scoop on good little pockets.  Good clipping stances but powerful climbing in between.  May be a bit hard for .12c
content.protection: 14 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: This climb climbs the transition between the upper scoop and the bulge.

content.description: Fun climbing right from the start.  Pockets and edges leading up to the scoop and a set of Climb Tech hooks.  Great and maybe a bit easy for 5.11a.
content.protection: 9 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: This is the first route left of the pointy black boulder.

content.description: Fat Bastard starts off a small boulder to the left of the big flake with Groovy Baby and Swinger. Easy climbing off big pockets on the slab leads into the overhang. Several holds have been filled in, making what used to be a fun 5.11d into a very stretchy and gymnastic climb with big dead points and dynos. Can be very difficult for short people. It felt roughly 12b to me.
content.protection: 8 quickdraws
content.location: Starts off a small boulder to the left of the big flake with Groovy Baby and Swinger.

content.description: Original route at this wall. Holds felt a little sharper than the nearby routes.
content.protection: 11 bolts

content.description: Extension to Dixie... just like the other extensions get ready to power through on pockets and maybe a mono or two.
content.protection: bolts to a 2 bolt sport anchor

content.description: Same first two moves as Oh Behave but head right to the big pocket.  Match in this to clip and make big committing moves.  Sequencing this correctly is key here.  This one feels more taxing and sustained than the others to the right.  Sporty Climb Tech hooks below the bulge.
content.protection: 8 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: At the far left of the rising shelf, this shares the start with Oh Behave but goes to the right.

content.description: Extension to Bong. Pull some big moves on small pockets through the buldge and just when you think the hard climbing is done it gets harder...
content.protection: bolts to a 2 bolt sport anchor.

content.description: Grab that big ass pocket and smear your feet on.  A small pocket helps you reach the clipping hold for the first bolt.  I would suggest a stick clip, as this is a pretty tough move.  Continue up the wall on some pretty crispy (sharp-ish, ouch!) pockets.  Only 6 clips on this one which may seem a bit sporty at times.  Sport anchor below the bulge.
content.protection: 6 bolts and fatty Climb Tech hooks for anchors
content.location: This one starts at the football sized pocket at head height.
